message: There will be (optional, extra cost) workshops on Sept 18th (a Sunday) prior to the conference and while I have a few of those scheduled already, I'd be really interested in what topics you would like to see at something like that.
I'm in the early process of soliciting keynotes and speakers for 2011.  If you've got suggestions of who you'd like to see, I'd be happy to hear them...
and I think Matthew McCullough will be doing a Git workshop
Hilary Mason will probably be doing a workshop on machine learning algorithms
I would _really_ like to see a Hilary Mason workshop. Her talk last year was great.
Big +1 on Hilary, her talk rocked.
i wish i had something/was interesting enough to offer to talk :)
@puredanger thief! :)
let me know, i'd definitely do it.
i'm following on twitter too, so i'll certainly be notified when
well then it's settled!
apgwoz - I've thought about doing a hack+tell during Strange Loop
I could talk about the tech behind Convore, if you think that would be interesting.
i'm hoping to get to strange loop this year
there are many ways to get notified of the CFP - I highly recommend http://lanyrd.com/2011/strange-loop - I'll add a CFP there and it should notify you if you're tracking the conf
or you can watch the Twitter feed here: http://twitter.com/#!/strangeloop_stl
@apgwoz - I thought maybe you could help :)
@apgwoz - depends on the schedule really.... still figuring out the details
when can people start submitting proposals?
@ericflo there will be an open CFP starting in late April timeframe and I'd love to have you submit a proposal
that answers my question too.
how long is the CFP open for? (i'll likely have a newborn in late april..)
also you can add yourself to the email list here: http://bit.ly/fhVtW4
Are you saying you're not going to post CFP on the linked in group? :-)
oh I'm sure it will also make it to LinkedIn, Facebook, the Google Group, etc eventually :)
if only there were more places I could post it!
I'll be keeping my eyes open for the CFP as well - got a couple of ideas including some for a workshop
Update on Strange Loop 2011 format and speakers...  http://bit.ly/fUlI3I
